items.sentence: Tom gets upset when Mary doesn\'t do what he tells her to do.
Tom got angry because I wasn\'t doing what he asked me to do.
Tom, Mary, John and Alice went to the same elementary school.
Tom and Mary seemed to be very happy to see each other again.
Tom and Mary were worried about getting caught by the police.
I need a list of all the dangerous neighborhoods in the city.
I once knew somebody named Tom, but that was a long time ago.
I only wish I had stopped Tom from doing such a stupid thing.
Tom\'s wide-eyed optimism is beginning to grate on my nerves.
I have two keys for the front door, but I can\'t find either.
Tom and Mary were here earlier, but now they\'ve disappeared.
Tom is very sleepy, because he didn\'t sleep well last night.
Tom will be very disappointed if Mary doesn\'t come to visit.
I don\'t care how much it costs. I\'m going to buy it anyway.
Where\'s your favorite place to go when you want to be alone?
Why did you hire me if you didn\'t think I could do that job?
Would you please tell Tom why you don\'t want him to do that?
You don\'t really think that Tom did that on purpose, do you?
I don\'t think Tom is going to want to go to Boston with you.
I wonder whether or not Tom is responsible for what happened.
